intro: Hieracium obovatifrons, commonly known as the broad-fronded hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has basal leaves that are broadly ovate and often covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers are typically arranged in a single head, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium obovatifrons is often found in meadows and grassy areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
